body:
@ashb  CI passed. Please take a look.

Another PR with the same change against master branch (https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4981) was already merged by Feng Tao.
ping @ashb
Tests passed on: https://travis-ci.org/milton0825/airflow/builds/511837166
PTAL @feng-tao @ashb
@gglanzani @Fokko  Is it correct now?
This is dangerous - it a user happens to run this on their host it will overwrite files!

> It would be good to consider the possibility to be able to set this per launched pod and also set the pod root filesystem to read only. See [mrunesson@ae2078d](https://github.com/mrunesson/airflow/commit/ae2078d89e61fc420958dc337d57b993f2218eb3) for concept implementation.

@mrunesson Thanks for the sample. I would implement this in a subsequent PR since this one is almost ready to be merged for 1.10.3.
Thanks for merging it! Big thanks for support and help for @FlyrInc !
@ashb done
@davlum my changes were merged, so I believe You can start working back on this PR.

Hi @sumous , I see nothing wrong from the current code.

May you attach a screenshot with the issue/error/bug you encountered? So that it will be easier for us to process your PR.
@Fokko I did that so often that I did `git config remote.pushDefault ashb`

@mik-laj Trying to pull this in to 1.10.3 and I'm getting some odd warnings (which we treat as errors):

```
/Users/ash/code/python/incubator-airflow/docs/_api/airflow/www_rbac/utils/index.rst:86: WARNING: Unexpected indentation.
/Users/ash/code/python/incubator-airflow/docs/_api/airflow/www_rbac/utils/index.rst:87: WARNING: Block quote ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.
```

I turned on keep files, and bigquery_hook/index.rst:276 maps  to this  line in my source https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/da224b901ecc8cf202e3e769d6d7c1c44ffde623/airflow/www/utils.py#L119-L120

Comparing to master:

https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/airflow/www/utils.py#L91-L92

The issue here is a the lack of a new line - I'm just not sure how this didn't fail CI as a result?

**Edit:** Ah, becaue _api/airflow/www is ignored right now. I'll just need to ignore www_rbac too.
Thanks @vapiravfif - I merged this form my own PR - but have kept your authorship on the commit!

@ashb I was assuming that we only invoke the script inside the Docker container but seems like that is not the case. Should we enforce that users to only run the script inside the container?

or we can use `-i` instead of `-f`
```
Cause ln to write a prompt to standard error if the target file exists.  If the
           response from the standard input begins with the character `y' or `Y', then
           unlink the target file so that the link may occur.  Otherwise, do not attempt
           the link.
```
@Fokko This should fix the flake8 issues :)
Thank you, Ash!
@feng-tao @ashb @milton0825 Just for clarification, it seems like this doesn't make any special exceptions for the 'mark success' (skip) functionality in backfill.  Is that correct?
@sosso you mean you want to `mark success` some tasks in the middle of the backfill to skip those tasks?
@GuzikJakub The tests are still failing ðŸ¤”
Hi Folks - Please let me know if you have any other advice/recommendation for me. Thanks
@XD-DENG @zhongjiajie - Please let me know if you have more comments/recommendations and should I resolve your comments.  Thanks

@ashb You're right. I will split this PR to two PRs. Today I studied the principles of the Reno tool. It is an interesting tool, but it should be introduced in a separate PR. I will try to prepare changes with a view to future adaptation Reno.
@mans2singh Hi, sorry to tell you that committer are busy in testing Apache Airflow next release, maybe they could not review the code untill Aiflow 1.10.3 finish test and release.
BTW, you could **click** *resolve conversation* button on the review when they was done, and left some still in discuss conversation open.  That will make committer more easier to review the code.
Please add unit tests.
Similar PR: https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4686

Thanks for pointing out the similar PR. @mik-laj 
Do a simple summary:
There are four tickets related to this issue. 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2141
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-3157
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-3864
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-4170

Two PR:
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4686
and this one.

> Please target against AIRFLOW-2141 instead.
@ashb You mentioned this in the other PR. Could I do the change instead?

Thank you!
@ashb will user run this script in local box instead of docker / CI? I don't get why user will like to run this script locally.
@zhongjiajie - Thanks for your feedback.  I am looking forward to the teams further comments/recommendations.  Mans

Hi,
I test it in mac air. python2.7 and python3.6 both got this error.
Airflow v1.10.1 depends on Flask-Admin v1.4.1, and Airflow v1.10.2 depends on Flask-Admin v1.5.2. The bug appeared because of  [Flask-Admin PR](https://github.com/flask-admin/flask-admin/commit/53d9d62926334ee018100104e8e293bc59ae7332#diff-4ff831250d18cbd878014d731ebc46eb) 

screenshot like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1303581/55135154-cfb80080-5165-11e9-9fc7-03c12b510f18.png)

Let me know if you think some of the tests are redundant. I just refactored the Secrets object to be a bit more intuitive. I find optionally setting attributes of an object to be very difficult to reason about.

Hi, I found [varimport](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/airflow/www/views.py#L2097) and [action_varexport](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/airflow/www/views.py#L2080) use its logic, which will lead to different behavior from that via CLI. Could we use CLI in these two methods?
Tests finally passing ðŸŽ‰

I think that it is worth extract common logic to a separate place and refer to it from both CLI and WEB.It will be clearer. In the near future, the refactoring of the CLI interface is planned. See: [AIP-16](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/AIP-16%3A+Use+nested+commands+in+CLI)
PTAL @Fokko @kaxil @feng-tao

is it sure to solve all the required problems? Please look at my PR:

https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4999

Main problem is in theme.
PTAL @Fokko @kaxil
@mik-laj doc-test passed in: https://travis-ci.org/milton0825/airflow/builds/512863905
not sure if we still need this given this pr(https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4998) solve the issue.
@feng-tao Agree. Iâ€™ll close this one later
That's great.
Closing this PR as there are other PRs addressing the issue thoroughly.

We only expect it to run in docker/docker-on-CI but if users do attempt to run this locally trying to follow run the CI locally we shouldn't overwrite files.

(I've had a report of this happening, so it's not an "it might happen" but "it has happened")

Given we also add to the end of authorized_keys maybe the better change here is to only run this script in the docker-container (by checking an env variable that we set somewhere?)
Today many follower catch and fix the same issue https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4999 https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4998
Heh/
I think the deprecation warning isn't a "sphinx" warning (but a normal python one) so we can leave this  until sphinx-rtd-theme updates (I saw you filed the issue there)
Docs step passed. Merging.
@zhongjiajie Thanks for being vigilant. In a moment I will compare the current file with the file from this PR.
@mik-laj Thanks.

Now the Flake8 is passing, but some actual tests are failing:

Conflicts, again ðŸ¤”
Love it

That looks like a bug in the tests:

```
b.put_object(Key=MOCK_FILES, Body=b'testing')
```

Key should be a single file, not a list of multiple ones?
@OmerJog You can also cherry-pick @rlkelly's work and continue with that.
@Fokko, I updated a PR
Try on Airflow 1.10.2?
@zhongjiajie Could you rebase please?
@kaxil Can you elaborate on what's going on here. I see that the current repository points to `kaxil/incubator-airflow-ci`. Can we change this for https://github.com/apache/airflow-ci

It also happen on kali linux.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1303581/55239284-53124880-5271-11e9-922d-e93b54b2319c.png)

@fokko @ashb -> I pushed the latest version with pretty much all comments applied (except setup.py).

There is one change that might require longer discussion/argumentation.

I had to change the ci image to use root rather than "airflow" user - so the Dockerfile is now configurable (main airflow image uses "airflow" user and "CI" image user root user. 

This was needed in order to replicate CI environment on Linux. I tested it now extensively on Linux and the main problem was that when you tried to map local source folder to the container, you could not easily map it as "airflow" user and the folders are not accesible to airflow user.

This is a known Docker problem (there is an open issue for that https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/2259 ). I looked at possible workaround, but it turns out, until this issue is solved, it's easiest if airflow is run as root (then everything is root-owned inside the container).

This problem does not occur on Mac because on Mac local volumes are mounted to virtual machine using user-space synchronising filesystem via virtual machine (which makes it much slower on one hand, but it allows to carry the user mapping with the bind volume). But if someone develops on Linux that could be a huge blocker for convenient development environment. 

I hope this is something that you will be able to live with :)

@ashb @fokko -> I pushed latest version that is much improved:

* mysql installation is now simplified, no more server-specific configuration (thanks @ashb for the hint)
* parameters for the database are now spread across various docker-compose files. I found it easiest to have separate compose file for each database and "compose" the files when running - so for example when you run it locally you compose : docker-compose.yml + docker-compose-postgres.yml + docker-compose-local.yml (the last one adds source bind mounts for local development). 

It's nicely modular but you might not like it. so if you don't let me know (and why) - I might try to find another solution.

Also after @ashb hangout I've decided to implement a small improvement in the 'run-test' script - now the database is initialized only the first time you run test in the container, subsequent times the database is not initialized (unless you specify --with-db-init switch). This is a nice automation for the pattern you explained in your hangout, where you mentioned you rarely use run_unit_tests.sh because database initialisation is slow. With the approach I suggest, you do not have to copy&paste things but can run the tests with the scripts. Combined with auto-complete, I think it's really helpful (especially to onboard new people).
